issue.title: [Docs] Update NodeJS version in the documentation image because version 11 is no longer maintained
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8436](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8436). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
```Java

================================================================================

                              DEPRECATION WARNING

  Node.js 11.x is no longer actively supported!

  You will not receive security or critical stability updates for this version.

  You should migrate to a supported version of Node.js as soon as possible.
  Use the installation script that corresponds to the version of Node.js you
  wish to install. e.g.

   * https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_10.x — Node.js 10 LTS "Dubnium" (recommended)
   * https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_12.x — Node.js 12 LTS "Erbium"

  Please see https://github.com/nodejs/Release for details about which
  version may be appropriate for you.

  The NodeSource Node.js distributions repository contains
  information both about supported versions of Node.js and supported Linux
  distributions. To learn more about usage, see the repository:
    https://github.com/nodesource/distributions

================================================================================
```
